Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Tricuspid Annuloplasty During Mitral Valve Surgery

Trial_Design.evidence: In a multicenter, randomised controlled trial, 401 patients were randomised

Intervention.evidence: 401 patients were randomised to MVS alone (n=203) or MVS with TA (n=198)

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the composite rate of death, re-operation for TR, or TR progression at 2 years.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed.

Number_Randomised.evidence: 401 patients were randomised to MVS alone (n=203) or MVS with TA (n=198)

Result_Outcome.evidence: A PPM was implanted in 36 patients (9.6%; 95% CI 6.8%−13.0%) within 2 years, with 30/187 (16.0%) in the MVS+TA group and 6/188 (3.2%) in the MVS group (RR 5.08; 95% CI 2.16–11.94; p<0.001).

Harms.evidence: A PPM was implanted in 36 patients (9.6%; 95% CI 6.8%−13.0%) within 2 years
